books.title: The Well of Loneliness
books.author: Radclyffe Hall
books.summary: A young woman struggles to understand and accept herself, and particularly her love of other women, in a society that rejects her unconventional behavior as unfeminine and even unnatural.

books.title: Catriona
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After coming into his fortune and evading his uncle’s schemes, young gentleman David Balfour continues his adventures in 18th century Scotland, helping a politically unwelcome friend escape into France, avoiding the hangman himself, finding his place as a gentleman in Edinburgh society, and falling in love with the daughter of a notorious Macgregor clansman.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: The Phoenix and the Carpet
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Five children once again encounter an ancient, magical creature and go on adventures around the world with its magic carpet.

books.title: The Man of Destiny
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Napoleon engages in a battle of wits to reclaim some stolen letters.

books.title: Pericles
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A Tyrian prince flees after he discovers a terrible secret.

books.title: The Lost Continent
books.author: C. J. Cutcliffe Hyne
books.summary: A swashbuckling adventure on the fabled continent of Atlantis.

books.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: The adventures of a young boy and his friend, an escaped slave, on the Mississippi river in the Antebellum South.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: M. R. James
books.summary: A collection of ghost stories written by M. R. James.

books.title: A Personal Record
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: Conrad recounts his childhood in Poland, his sailing experiences, and the work on his debut novel.

books.title: Murder in the Maze
books.author: J. J. Connington
books.summary: Twin brothers are found murdered in a maze, and the local Chief Constable must solve the crime.

books.title: The Humbugs of the World
books.author: P. T. Barnum
books.summary: American archetype and cultural founding father P. T. Barnum shares a collection of anecdotes that he deems “humbugs”—fodder for the gullible, deserving of skepticism—with the goal of making his fellow citizens a little wiser and more skeptical.

books.title: Walden
books.author: Henry David Thoreau
books.summary: Thoreau’s report on his social experiment of solitude, simplicity, and self-reliance.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s poetry.

books.title: The Surprising Adventures of Baron Munchausen
books.author: Rudolph Erich Raspe
books.summary: The legendary Baron Munchausen’s tall tales of wonder and adventure.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Robert Sheckley
books.summary: A collection of science fiction and fantasy stories by Robert Sheckley ordered by date of publication.

books.title: School Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s school stories about the lives and adventures of schoolboys in the early 1900s.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.
